workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 6.2 - Openers
workout_file.description: This is a great workout to do before your race. They are typically performed the day before a big day, and touch each of the energy systems relevant for performance. This should leave you feeling better at the end of the workout than it did in the beginning, and is NOT meant for training purposes.

textevent.message: Welcome, friend! Let's start off with a long and progressive warm-up.
Keep your cadence ~80 RPM to start. We will be increasing by 10 RPM with each subsequent block today.
Today is all about getting your legs, and especially your mind, ready for what comes tomorrow.
Which is of course your big race! You'll be ready to CRUSH it!
So, throughout the next 30min, work on getting in "the zone" and preparing yourself!
This workout does involve some intensity and some hard efforts.
BUT you will feel better getting off the bike than you did getting on.
Today is NOT about training, so make sure you respect the intensity levels and time today.
We have another minute here, then we increase the effort and cadence slightly
In 10sec, get ready to increase your cadence to ~90 RPM, and add a little more effort
Pick it up just a bit here, this should still feel relatively light and easy.
4min here.
Coming up next, increase your effort even further and bring that cadence up to ~95 RPM!
Bring it up! Maintain your form over these next 2 blocks.
Remember, a faster cadence should not result in sloppy form!
Hips locked into that saddle, shoulders relaxed, elbows bent slightly, light grip on those bars.
In 10sec, bring it up even more and ~100 RPM!
QUICK QUICK QUICK!
Maintain that form here still, just really getting those leg muscles loose.
1 more minute to go!
Good work! Now take the effort and cadence down really easy and recover from that initial ramp up.
Take a few deep breaths here - Continue getting into your "zone"
Picture yourself CRUSHING whatever it is you're doing tomorrow!
Coming up in 10sec, we're doing a 3min zone 5 effort at 100 RPM...Get ready!
Let's get it! Spin those legs quickly here and stay in zone 5!
1min in, keep it going here and find that rhythm!
30sec left!
Great work, now bring it down easy again for a couple of minutes
Take some deep breaths here - FOCUS.
Keep on taking frequent sips of fluid here too, always stay on top of your hydration.
Next up is 1min at the higher end of zone 5. I want your cadence REALLY quick here at 110 RPM!
PUSH IT!!! FAST FEET!
30sec LEFT!
Beautiful work! Just a couple more intervals to go and we're putting this one in the books.
Take another 2min easy before we put the finishing touches on those legs.
Deep breaths...Keep your focus on tomorrow!
Next up, we're going to hit your anaerobic energy system, and work it a bit.
We're aiming for 2 reps, of 30sec at Zone 6, at 110+ RPM, with 30sec easy.
Stand up and accelerate for the 1st 15sec of these, REALLY WORK HERE!
STAND UP AND ACCELERATE! PUSH IT!
Good, now sit back down and DRIVE IT HOME!
Excellent! Now bring it way down and get ready for 1 more of those.
STAND UP AGAIN! DIG DIG DIG!
SIT BACK DOWN, DRIVE IT!!!
NICE! That's it, my friend. Let's spin super easy for the next 2min :-)
Keep on spinning easy here and take a few deep breaths.
Whatever it is you're doing tomorrow, KNOW YOU WILL DO GREAT!
Good luck tomorrow, I believe in you!
